column5: The ratio of views/replies might be a record for this site X2. Wanted to comment about it but it's glaringly obvious. No way a new male member would get as many  views.

Your right look at the three new guys I guess they are not steel headers lol. I guess we have a bunch of single guys here fishing is right.  As Joey said most are harmless. If your at the sportsman show on musky Sunday stop by the musky Canada area you can chat with my wife she is a fishing freak also. Not alot of girls posting anymore my wife was as were a bunch of others but they seem to marry off and leave with members from the board lol.
The ratio of views/replies might be a record for this site   think they were expecting more from the topic title with the name
think they were expecting more from the topic title with the name  I'm thinking you were correct.   I wonder how many marriage proposals the poor girl has got via PM, lol!

I'm thinking you were correct.   I wonder how many marriage proposals the poor girl has got via PM, lol!   haha yea.....altough she happens to be a pretty nice girl, and can cut jokes with the best of them, almost like one of the guys, and she knows how to catch fish
You are the best

Steel bunny,  You might as well have walked into an army base.  What happens when fisherMEN see you on the water pullin fish? lol... Do they give you all of their secret spots??  I've always wanted to try for steelies but never knew any spots. I just found a spot veeerrryyy close to my area in the west end of the city. Gonna try to hammer some come season
haha yea.....altough she happens to be a pretty nice girl, and can cut jokes with the best of them, almost like one of the guys, and she knows how to catch fish   You are the best
April Vokey look out we have our own damsel from Durham, might see a sharpe jump in the Northern boys coming to the east ditches this year for a glimpse at the steel bunny
Welcome to the board Steel Bunny!

Geez, I'm going to tell my sister to sign up for OFC. Then I'll get all your guys secrets.  In all seriousness though everyone here is super nice and has already given me tons of fishing secrets.  Welcome SteelBunny.
Tom Jones....really? So what else do you listen to mike?
Tom Jones....really? So what else do you listen to mike?  Ya,I thought he could of done better,but Tom is a heart throbber,,,,for some. LOL
Looks like Steel Bunny has star status already and some seem to be smitten!!!  :wub:  .
Nice avatar and intro. Tights Lines

Steel bunny,  You might as well have walked into an army base.  LOL! It's actually a little overwhelming...  What happens when fisherMEN see you on the water pullin fish? lol... Do they give you all of their secret spots?? haha....i get a few good tidbits every now and then (but secret spots stay that way with me  I've always wanted to try for steelies but never knew any spots. I just found a spot veeerrryyy close to my area in the west end of the city. Gonna try to hammer some come season Ha!  It's addicting.....might as well start saying goodbye to your family and friends
Nice avatar and intro. Tights Lines  Thank you   Nice dog.
Looks like Steel Bunny has star status already and some seem to be smitten!!!  :wub:  .  Wait till they see my hookset!!!!
April Vokey look out we have our own damsel from Durham, might see a sharpe jump in the Northern boys coming to the east ditches this year for a glimpse at the steel bunny
Welcome Aboard Tight Lines SBK
And while everybody is trying to impress the lady, that will leave a lotta empty territory for me along the Eastern Tribs . . . .      welcome aboard  Steel Bunny . . .   .
YOU'D THINK THIS WAS r/gonefishingwild

YOU'D THINK THIS WAS r/gonefishingwild   Ahahahah! Now wouldn't that be a subreddit worth checkin oot.  And while everybody is trying to impress the lady, that will leave a lotta empty territory for me along the Eastern Tribs . . . .      welcome aboard  Steel Bunny . . .   .   If that's the case maybe I'll actually try some tribs near home. I can't stand shoulder-to-shoulder fishing, so I usually opt out and drive north.
I rarely get to fish for 'bows, but I love reading them reports.  Welcome
Welcome! You made me google map Durham  ...then I remembered where it was Ever fish Saugeen by Southampton? Pretty good spot for steelers. Maybe we could carpool sometimes
I see a lot of guys "fishing" here lol
Truth be told I had no idea what I was missing!  Me too  welcome aboard
Steelies & specks for me
No need to welcome me staffman, we already know eachother...dontwe ?  Yes we do !

I see a lot of guys "fishing" here lol LOL!!!!!  So its not just me...  Welcome to the site.  I'm sure you will fit in just fine here.  I'm an EX Durham person but you have lots of good spots to go all year long.
Geez, you guys are going too easy on her
Steelhead...isn't that some sort of muskie bait?
More women always welcome.  One's that fish, all the better.  Welcome aboard SBunny.
Welcome! Tonnes of great spots in Durham.
Easy now guys....  Welcome.....I know I few steelhead junkies around here.....they pop up from time to time
Well Steel Bunny, nice to see another gal on here.  Don't let the boys tease you too much.  They are all harmless sweetie pies
Steelhead.....some people have trouble pronouncing rainbow.
You must be ancient! LOL
Welcome!   Your float is  down!
Welcome aboard ! lots of Steelheaders here ....   Speak up Julian, I can't hear you!!
Welcome to the board. I'm more of a Brook Trout/Musky guy but I get the allure of steelheading particularly with all those tribs in your back yard.

Steelhead.....some people have trouble pronouncing rainbow. hahaha I thought the same thing. Kinda reminds me about Steel Town, Stelco, Work You're right, I'd sooner catch Rainbow Trout and an odd Sheephead
I see a lot of guys "fishing" here lol  Same exact thought here too!

Welcome to the board SB. Fished creeks and rivers east of the GTA a quarter century ago when tree canopied waters ran cold and the fish were plentiful and it still took me almost full fall and spring cycles to land my first Bow. Years afterwards it became a case of basically taking fish at will until moving to making tin rather than rubber soles the choice mode of transport over water.  Enjoy the sport and the board as there are more than a few fin junkies here who possess a wealth of knowledge to answer questions and lead you in the right direction regardless your species of choice.

haha! I am overwhelmed with how nice you all are....and funny too!  I had a few good laughs reading through the thread.  Thank you so much, I am looking forward to expanding my network of fishing junkies

haha! I am overwhelmed with how nice you all are....and funny too!  I had a few good laughs reading through the thread.  Thank you so much, I am looking forward to expanding my network of fishing junkies  Send pics!!
The ratio of views/replies might be a record for this site
The ratio of views/replies might be a record for this site  "Dear Canadian Tire" has it beat

Hi all, I am a new member, looking to learn a few things and meet others who share my insane obsession with fishing.  The more you get to know me, the more you will see that I am sicka than your average......  I am from Durham, fishing mostly the east side of the GTA. I like to fish for anything that swims but my real passion is steelheading.  I get out as often as I can which has been 3-4 times a week on average.  First light, after work or mid day....I'll take what I can get.  Right now I'm float fishing but I just picked up my first fly rod and I cannot wait to learn on brookies this spring!  Does anyone else feel the way I do about steelheading? Thats probably a silly question....
Welcome to the forum. Never fished for the steel, pickerel guy here.
Welcome aboard ! lots of Steelheaders here ....

Welcome to the forum. Never fished for the steel, pickerel guy here.   Thanks Bernie,  Sad to hear about the steel thing   ....you should give it a shot this year.  Truth be told I had no idea what I was missing!
Welcome aboard ! lots of Steelheaders here ....  Thanks jd  Nice laker in your profile pic.....thats the next trophy on my list

Most Steelhead guys on here need someone to teach them how to fish, some even try to build steelhead rods with cloth- line pulley reels on them. If you need any advise on Sheephead or Perch fishin just ask me, "I'm a PRO" Welcome aboard, SB Just don't take anyone on here to serious, just me. Time for me to turn my PC off
Welcome aboard!

Welcome to the forum!  I was a complete newbie to creek fishing when I joined the forum.  I learned by walking all the creeks from Duffin's east to Cobourg.  Once I finally got into my first steel I was hooked!  It's harder for me to find the time to fish now (Back then I fished as much as you do now!!), but maybe I should dust off my float gear and see what's still out there!
Welcome aboard, Steel Bunny! Looking forward to reading your reports.
Welcome.
Welcome aboard!!  Been chasing river fish since before the internet was born.
Welcome to the board
Welcome to the forum. Now days I almost exclusively chase steelhead with one of those " clothe-pin " reels. I concentrate on Lake Huron tribs.

Welcome to the forum. Now days I almost exclusively chase steelhead with one of those " clothe-pin " reels. I concentrate on Lake Huron tribs.  No need to welcome me staffman, we already know eachother...dontwe ?
Welcome aboard!. I do have a passion for steel and chrome but do my fishing for them on the big lake.  A little more room out there....some days.  lol.
Pft, steelhead...  It's all about carp, suckers and catfish.  /sarcasm

Right on.  I'm a wannabee steelie bum too.  Don't get out nearly as much as I want to though..  Some pretty chill fisherfolk here..  Come to think of it, an ofner pretty much put me onto my first steelie.  Guy by the name of FHR.  That was over ten years ago..  Welcome aboard!  cheers HD
Welcome aboard there are lots of members that fish out that way I bet you ran into a bunch fishing them waters
Hi FG, welcome to OFC.  We have some of the best steelheaders here for sure, stay tuned!
I HATE STEELHEAD!      Not really........... Lake Erie tribs and surf fishing for me. South shore   WELCOME!

Welcome aboard.  I spend a lot of time fishing for chrome... I hope some day to spend more time catching them LOL.  I mostly fish on the Lake Huron tribs as I seem to hit other areas when the fish are on vacation.
Hi FG, welcome to OFC.  We have some of the best steelheaders here for sure, stay tuned! HUH
Welcome to the board! I'm an avid steelheader myself, you'll love it here I'm sure.
Welcome to the board, its a blast seeing all these new faces lately. You will be amazed at how helpful everybody here can be, dont be afraid to ask or PM the members. Cheers!
Steelheader eh? I'm from the Durham region as well. I've tried my luck at steelheading, I've only caught one... maybe I could learn something from you. I'm more of a bass man myself.
